choices.C: It was inappropriate because it placed a heavy burden on students to successfully complete the exercise.
choices.D: It was inappropriate because it did not offer students a stated learning result applicable to their experience
choices.A: It was appropriate because use of the exercises covered the gap in the timing of the course.
choices.B: It was appropriate because the students were given a frame of reference upon which to apply what they learned.

discussion.content:
B. It was appropriate because the students were given a frame of reference upon which to apply what they learned.

When an instructor finishes the course material early, it is important to find a productive way to fill the remaining time. Option A implies that the instructor's actions were purely to fill the gap in timing, which is not necessarily the best use of the remaining time. Option C is not true because the instructor provided a timeline for the overall task completion, which suggests that the expectations were reasonable. Option D is also not true because the task assigned allowed the learners to apply what they learned, which is a stated learning result. Therefore, option B is the best choice because the task assigned provided the learners with a practical and relevant context in which to apply their new knowledge. This can help them better understand the material and reinforce their learning.

questions.question_text: An instructor completed the required content of a technical course early. The instructor decided to fill the time by writing tasks on the board and assigning them to individual students. A timeline was provided for the overall task completion and all students were expected to apply their new knowledge to the task assigned. The instructor then proceeded to work on plans for the next course in this situation, which of the following statements about the appropriateness of the activity is true?

discussion.content: Why ask just the advanced learners, though? Even if many of them know the beginner material, assuming everyone is advanced and then going straight to the advanced learners and asking them what they'd like to cover doesn't seem productive. There could be several levels of learners in the class. I think in that case, option D would be the best. You could modify the curriculum as needed. Option D never said to modify the ENTIRE curriculum. It just said to modify for the learners, which makes the most sense

The best option in this situation would be to choose option B: Ask the advanced learners what they would like to cover in the course and then change objectives based on advanced learner's requests.

This approach would not only keep the advanced learners engaged but also challenge them with more advanced material. It also allows the instructor to personalize the course content to the learners' needs, which can help increase the effectiveness of the course.

Option A would be suitable if only a few learners expressed familiarity with the content. However, if the majority of the learners are already familiar with the material, continuing the class as planned may lead to disengagement from the learners who are already familiar with the content.

Option C may not be the best approach as the experienced learners may not have the time or resources to return for another course. Additionally, it is not an effective solution for the current course.

Option D may also be suitable, but it may not be necessary to modify the entire curriculum. Instead, modifying some parts of the curriculum or introducing more advanced topics based on the learners' requests may be sufficient.

questions.question_text: An instructor is teaching a beginner topic. Most of the learners explain that they are already familiar with the course content. Which of the following should the instructor do?

choices.A: Continue the class as planned assuring completion of current course objectives
choices.D: Modify the curriculum as necessary to fulfill student expectations while still meeting course objectives.
choices.C: Ask the experienced learners to return for a more advanced course
choices.B: Ask the advanced learners what they would like to cover in the course and then change objectives based on advanced learner's requests.

questions.question_text: While giving an overhead presentation the projector being used powers off. Which of the following is the FIRST course of action?

discussion.content:
The correct answer is:
D. Have technical support correct the problem immediately during class

The FIRST course of action would be D. Have technical support correct the problem immediately during class. This will minimize the disruption to the presentation and allow the presenter to continue without significant interruption. The technical support can try to troubleshoot and fix the issue as quickly as possible while the presenter engages the audience in other ways such as asking questions or using physical handouts. If the problem cannot be resolved quickly, then the presenter can consider other options such as taking a break or continuing the presentation without the projector.

choices.A: Take a break and have technical support address the problem.
choices.D: Have technical support correct the problem immediately during class
choices.B: Lecture from the instructor notes until the next break.
choices.C: Dismiss the class until the projector can be fixed.

questions.question_text: A contract instructor has been hired to teach a course with twelve learners. After surveying the learners it is identified that half of the class is not familiar with the subject being taught. Which of the following should the instructor do to help the entire class achieve success?

choices.C: Make the six learners that already know the material wait until the other learners catch up
choices.A: Contact the training manager for suggestions on how to proceed.
choices.D: Cancel the class and then divide the class into two difference courses.
choices.B: Teach to the more experienced learners; the others will catch up.

discussion.content: A. Contact the training manager for suggestions on how to proceed.
